Reviews.Title: Great, I love it!
Reviews.Author: Darkside Pacific
Reviews.Content: I'm a producer and gamer. I chose this laptop due to it having a numeric keypad, four cores, 4GB of DDR3 and a 500GB HDD. The bottlenecking point seems to be the GPU. It can generally get pretty hot when you're playing a game, and it used to shut off from overheating, but that problem disappeared after I bought a cooling pad, which you should be using anyways. Battery lasts OK - give or take three hours while gaming or rendering, and up to five hours when doing web browsing or other small stuff. No touchscreen, but I wouldn't buy one of those since I don't like Windows 8. The touchpad recognizes multi-touch commands.I'd recommend this laptop for people looking for a decent machine that they can game with for the next few years, for under $500.

Reviews.Title: disappointed
Reviews.Author: birdlady777
Reviews.Content: Keyboard replaced in 1 yr,  alot of lag, poor  sound, paid 429.00 , should  have  did more reaserch  before i purchasedit.Bought at  best buy. Should have stayed with  HP products. and spent a little more money  for a  better laptop

Reviews.Title: Acer Laptop Review
Reviews.Author: Matt Bulko
Reviews.Content: Very happy with new laptop!  No problem starting it up, never lags.  Had an Acer before and never had an issue.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Had it for about 1 - 1 1/2 years, works well still. Not really any lag problems consistent with lower end laptops, but Skype does freeze up the computer anytime I even load it up. I can have any other program open (dozens of programs open at once) and it doesn't cause me any problems, though.

Reviews.Title: Leaves A Lot To Be Desired Aspire 551-8887
Reviews.Author: Nick Mundo
Reviews.Content: The Acer Aspire 551-8887 Windows 7 Home Premium.  I have owned Acer products in the past and had great success with them.  I should have returned the laptop the next day when I hear my sales person tell another shopper, stay away from this one.  I wish I had.  Its now on its second mother board and the widely problematic atheros wireless adapter.  Last warranty from geek squad city left me with a new unidentifiable motherboard without any serial number and a wireless card that lasted 6 days.  When it does work the AMD A8 Quad 4 processor is quit nice, but it spends more time being repaired and windows reinstalled so I never really get to use it.  Being bought as a christmas present, best buy or acer wont do anything except keep changing parts.  STAY AWAY FROM ACER AT ALL COSTS IT IS NOT WORTH IT !
